title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: V. W. Curtis to Orlando Brown, July 17, 1865
summary: Curtis details the organization and division of his Military District in Virginia. He designates Staunton to be the Sub-District headquarters for Augusta and four surrounding counties. Curtis instructs Brown to designate men to serve as Bureau superintendents for districts that correspond to the Military organization to avoid conflicts and lack of personnel.
keywords: Administration/Bureaucracy, Military Authority, American Civil War
